content.description: Pull Yourself Together is the sit start on Clayface using matched hands on a big jug low and right on the boulder. Work up on Undercling sidepulls and oppositional feet. Find the good spots to commit to on this very slick water polished rock. Make sure your shoes are dry!
content.location: Bottom of the canyon just south of the three waterfalls.(34.7066028, -98.6828574)

content.description: Matt Hagen Is History is the stand/crouch start on Clayface using matched hands on a big jug low and right on the boulder. Work up on Undercling sidepulls and oppositional feet. Find the good spots to commit to on this very slick water polished rock. Make sure your shoes are dry!
content.location: At the lowest point of the canyon just 30 yds south of the triple waterfall is a rock that looks like a head facing south down the canyon. This is Clayface. (34.7066028, -98.6828574)

content.description: Clayface Boulder sits at the bottom of the canyon and when viewed from the east as you head down looks like a Face with the chin nose and mouth facing left south down the creek.Clayface is super smooth from the water polishing it over time. Painless polished choss free holds - nice relief in the Wichitas!
